title: King of Kongo Letter - identify significance

content.question: Which of the following historical developments best identifies the letter’s significance to early generations of the African diaspora in the Americas ?

choices.label: Many West Central Africans were Christians before their forced transport to the Americas.
The rulers of the Kingdom of Kongo were unable to limit the enslavement of West Central Africans.
The complexity of Africa’s ancient societies supported Africans’ independence from European colonialism.
Technological and agricultural innovations propelled the population growth of West Central African peoples.

content.answer: Many West Central Africans were Christians before their forced transport to the Americas.
